file_content.text: Argh... incredible.
I hope your masters reward you well for such savage efficiency. The Empire certainly would.
No sudden moves, Sith. It's over.
Stay right there!
Not likely I'm joining your cause at this point.
Save the recruitment speech.
Such a shame. The Sith would have rewarded your skills well, had you made wiser affiliations.
Taking down filth like you is all the payment I need.
The job is its own reward.
Heh, yes. Savor your victory, the domination of your foe.
What now, then? Kill me, and parade my corpse as a trophy for your cause? You know I'm quite a prize.
It's time to face justice, my lord.
You'll stand trial.
Ugh. Much less embarrassing to just die here and be forgotten.
I don't know what will happen to you, but Dagger Wing will finally be cleared.
It's not up to me.
I doubt your masters have the slightest interest in absolving Dagger Wing's guilt. Better to hold it over them.
Sweet dreams, my lord.
Now you shut up. [Hit Ondorru]
I've got to admit, I never thought I'd see a Sith Lord get punched out.
Hmm. A violation of POW guidelines, but it's probably best if he's kept unconscious until properly restrained.
I will maintain full weapon readiness should the prisoner attempt escape.
Finally. I thought that guy would never shut up.
Where chaos reigned, silence takes hold. Through violence, at last, quietude.
Major? Major! Form a perimeter, people!
Heard you and Gall were crazy enough to come down here. We thought we'd help, but... we found Gall's body.
I guess we were--whoa! Is that... shock-cuffs and tranquilizers, people, now!
I already knocked him out for you, Zess. Nothing to worry about.
Don't worry, he's unconscious.
Sith prisoners are always full of surprises. I'll feel better when we've got him locked up.
He's a powerful Sith, Zess. Do you have anywhere to lock him up?
Be careful with this one.
You better believe it. We'll give you a comfy new home, my lord, don't worry.
Just let me know if I can help, Captain.
Need a hand?
It's fine. Not the first Sith we've locked up on Belsavis.
Lock this filth in the deepest, darkest cell you've got.
Take this scum away.
Will do.
I... you... ugh.
Dagger Wing hopped a shuttle to the space station. I'll contact Harlan... gonna to be tough on them, losing Gall like this.
It's never easy to lose your CO. But Gall wanted it this way.
I can imagine.
Harlan's a good guy. He'll get them through it.
Gall sacrificed himself to give the Daggers a chance at a clean record.
At least we got Ondorru.
I'm not surprised. Still... don't think any of them would've wanted to trade their reputations for Gall.
The Daggers are headed for the front lines--no room for distractions.
They'd better get over it.
Hopefully Harlan can pull them all together in time.
Better get this Sith out of here before he wakes up. Been a pleasure working with you, Major. Take care out there.
Haha!
Yaaahh!
This is the power of the Force!
My lord! Enemy forces spotted!
My lord! Enemy soldier spotted!
I'm aware, Captain. I thought I might like a closer look this time. Such persistence is worthy of study.
Come, come, let's have a look at you and see if--ugh. Not even human. So unimpressive.
Come closer, let's have a look. Hmph. Nothing particularly impressive.
Tell your men to drop their weapons, Ondorru--it's over!
Surrender!
Don't be ridicu... wait. Captain--I sense fear in you! Please explain.
Ahem... according to the uniform, my lord, this is the commander of Havoc Squad. The most elite soldiers in the Republic.
Ahem... their markings, my lord. They're from Havoc Squad. Sir.
You tricked Dagger Wing into slaughtering helpless people. You're going to pay.
Time to face justice for Fest.
Fest! Quite a trade--a few citizens for the Republic's finest pilots. My masterstroke, perhaps.
Full of yourself, aren't you?
Like a simple beast, wandering into a trap. No concept that you could be obliterated in the span of a second.
Hmm. I suppose you must possess some worthwhile bit of savagery to have survived this place.
Still, nothing to compare with the treasures that surround us. Deadly species older than history itself, killers unmatched in modern times!
This is your last chance, Ondorru--I won't ask again.
You need to give it up.
Surely even the Republic isn't desperate enough to employ deaf soldiers.
Rant all you want, I'm still bringing you in.
Go ahead, keep talking.
Just wait 'til you see the inside of a Republic prison cell.
The tour ends here.
I've already seen several on my way across Belsavis--hardly impressive compared to the ones we have back home.
You're fortunate to be so delusional. You can go to your grave feeling like a hero, instead of an idiot.
Some room please, Captain--I'm feeling rather inspired. Let's begin.
